job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Patchogue, NY
pros: Great place to work. Family and community driven.
cons: Not many cons if any while working.

pros: Almost every colleague is nice and well-meaning. You become close with your unit. There's that small-town, community feel. Nurses are paid well but the work is tough.
cons: The level of understaffing is abhorrent. It's impossible to provide quality care within the restraints of not having enough support staff. Hopefully with NYU, more people will apply to this hospital and actually stay.

pros: Good teamwork, good benefits, 4 weeks vacation, flexible scheduling
cons: Lack of resources, 7:1 patient-to-nurse ratio on med-surg with no regard to acuity, no charge nurse, lack of ancillary staff

job_title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room in Patchogue, NY
pros: Good staff to work with
cons: Understaffed overworked organizations changing over to nyu

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in East Patchogue, NY
pros: ED staff is amazing. They work together like family.
cons: Managerial retention rates very low. Always a new boss with a new plan.

job_title: Nurses Aide in East Patchogue, NY
pros: Most employees are nice and helpful. Hospital is growing through big changes now, things will likely improve over time.
cons: Some managers are difficult to deal with. Pay not very competitive at the moment. Location and demographic of this hospital affects it negatively.

pros: NYU Langone has taken over and started implementing certain changes.
cons:
As the RN you have to do everything yourself. 
Pharmacy always sends patients medications in the morning with one or two medications missing, then points a finger at the RN when you request they send a Gabapentin.
As the RN you are told that you should make sure the CNAs on 1:1 assignments are relieved for their breaks, meanwhile you rarely if ever get a break as the nurse. 
Management creates unsafe environment by making poor decisions in order to get patients out of the ED faster.

pros: Nice benefits and time off
cons: A lot of turnover for nurses

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in East Patchogue, NY
pros: 12 hour Shift only 3 days a week

review_title: Working at Long Island Community Hospital
pros: Great friendly but overworked staff
cons:
Continues to have very poor management. Few good managers left way overworked and overwhelmed. Nonstop resignations in every department and no one cares. No one ever replaced, burden just added on to those who stay.




. Expected to do the work of three people. Guess they are just trying to run it into the ground until being taken over. No one who leaves is ever replaced!! Burden just added to those who stay.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Long Island City, NY
pros: Great staff and union benefits
cons: short staffed often and no help from upper management

review_title: Management Leaves Much to Be Desired
pros: Good salary and benefits package
cons: Management doesn't seem to know what it's doing. One of my former bosses summed it up nicely when he said "All they do all day long is go around putting out fires." There is no planning. The physical appearance of the place is terrible. Carpets look ratty and stained.  And despite what they say, management doesn't care about its staff.  Little simple courtesies just don’t exist. They don’t think that way. When I left after many years of gainful employment not even a phone call wishing me well. These are the little things that make the difference and this place just doesn't have it. And if you can't do the little things you certainly won't do the big ones.

pros: Brookhaven hospital pays very well and they have a good benefits and retirement package. The assistant director of nursing is really fair and understanding of her employees.
cons: The overnight shift workers are often left out of social functions and activities and blamed for almost everything that goes wrong. There is no unity at Brookhaven and the employees are not supportive of one another (especially the 3pm to 11pm shift). The physicians often under medicate and ignore patient requests. Poor documentation by a majority of nursing staff. Inadequate report/handoff. Understaffed and difficult to get time off when working overnights.

review_title: I worked in psych department for 5 years very good team nice new emergency psych unit however in basement of hospital
pros: The health benefits are good...seasoned employes in psych er...very fair salary... Hospital will help pay for schooling
cons: Management constantly changing and is horrible...No union no real protection aside from doing your job...

pros: A lot of really good people who really care about the outcomes. I never had a bad day and I was never treated poorly. I made a lot of great friends there. There seems to be an attempt at a cultural change which is badly needed so they get kudos for trying. Many people there truly want to make a difference.
cons:
Follow through, really lacking. Many people fail to show up to meetings and if they do show up they show up without their work done, which prevents anything from actually occurring. 

Meetings - to many of them, it feels like administration purposefully keeps themselves and management in so many meetings in order to insulate themselves from real issues.

Communication - not to good for some departments. Literally some departments thought a report was functioning in error for 7 months because their supervisor never told them why it printed the way it did. This is a two fold problem, supervision not communicating a necessary change in process to help with better and more directed care and support staff being/feeling to ineffectual to even ask why things are happening.

Culture - There are some really good players, but they leave the institution due to failing administration and department heads. A lot of staff that should not be there due to ineptitude and poor attitude remain and get promoted...One example of a complaining not getting with the program staff is when a former executive was giving a speech on trying to change the culture to be more hospitable, he was telling a story about how a nurse aide was listening to what he thought was P-Diddy (who cares who it really was), but the message was this person was totally despondent towards the care of the patient and the only thing this nurse took from that story was "He said she was listening to P-Diddy" and she complained to the exec team about it, people with that attitude should not be working there, fire them, they are a downfall to the hospital.

Cleanliness - it's bad, I could not go there a single day without seeing garbage on the floors, dirty floors, cracked floors and tiles, this is what patients need to recoup in? Very poor image

Information - stop trying to hide it. Example, the hospital applied and received a $5 million plus grant, but had refused to tell employees that, by the way it was on the local news so it's not exactly  super secret information. This information was out for months before I left and administration still never made it public. Most likely using it to fill budget gaps.

pros: Great location. Salary and benefits okay. Patients mostly from nursing homes and the local communities . Most have many chronic illnesses and you can learn a lot from them. Great respiratory therapists!
cons: Very high turnover due to lack of support and bullying from management. Very few overworked educators. New grads must hope at least one senior nurse on to ask questions. Too high nurse patient ratio as our patients are very sick.

review_title: Physicians and colleagues in other departments exhibit considerable respect for respiratory therapists' skills.
job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Patchogue, NY
pros: A positive aspect of working as an RT at Brookhaven is that respiratory therapists respond to almost every emergent event that takes place, in all areas of the hospital. Consequently, one rarely suffers from the monotony of doing the same kind of procedure over and over, as may be the case for RTs at facilities that more narrowly restrict their scope of practice.
cons: The shift schedule seems to be a little out of sync with those nearby hospitals. This sometimes makes it tough to plan ahead for per diem shifts at other facilities.

review_title: It was like one big family.
pros: Rewarding, educational, friends, Co workers, a lot of different avenues for growth
cons: Personal mediator to go to bat for you, with you who knows all the rules, rights and regulations. Just going to your supervisor sometimes is not enough.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Medford, NY
pros: Brookhaven Memorial Hospital Medical Center has always been a great place for me to work.  I have been treated fairly.
cons: At Brookhaven Memorial Hospital Medical Center, the employees are not always treated nicely by the patients and visitors.  This is partly due to the location and the clientele that come to Brookhaven.

job_title: Professional Registered Nurse in Patchogue, NY
pros: Very nice, professional coworkers who work hard to give good,  compassionate care to our patients
cons: Extremely poor management, especially middle management,  who it seems,  are told to bully and berate the employees. All employees,  not just nursing staff.  Very heavy and unmanageable and unsafe workloads.

pros: Good people and leadership. Gain a lot of experience in many areas. Always something new in the works. Always something to do.
cons: Pay is ok. Patients are sometimes hard to deal with. Clinical worker ca be mandated to stay later for coverage of other shifts

pros: Working at Brookhaven Hospital Medical Center was a rewarding experience for me.  I became a seasoned nurse during my tenure there.
cons: Staffing is a major issue in most healthcare settings.

review_title: My experience working here at Brookhaven is Challenging
pros: Pros are that you can grow from this job and working in a Hospital, helping many people.
cons: Cons are that its very stressful dealing with some patients... You HAVE to have a lot of patience and keep it...

pros: There are  opportunities for advancement.
cons: Tight budget, expect to do more than your fair share.

review_title: Worked at Long Island Community Hospital for 11 years
pros: Professional and friendly community hospital
cons: No cons at this time.
